2.1 Systems of Linear Equations 21
Figure 2.3 The
solution space of a
system of two linear
equations with two
variables can be
geometrically
interpreted as the
intersection of two
lines. Every linear
equation represents
a line.
2x1 − 4x2 = 1
4x1 + 4x2 = 5
x1
x2
is a solution of the system of linear equations, i.e., we obtain a solution
set that contains inﬁnitely many solutions.
In general, for a real-valued system of linear equations we obtain either
